channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Phoenix police have a pattern of violating civil rights, Justice Dept. report says
item.description: Phoenix police discriminate against Black, Hispanic and Native American people, unlawfully detain homeless people and use excessive force, according to a sweeping federal civil rights investigation.
item.content:encoded:
Phoenix police discriminate against Black, Hispanic and Native American people, unlawfully detain homeless people and use excessive force, according to a sweeping federal civil rights investigation.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Justice Thomas took more trips paid for by GOP donor than he disclosed, senator says
item.description: The trips were revealed by a subpoena of Harlan Crow, the conservative mega donor.
item.content:encoded:
The trips were revealed by a subpoena of Harlan Crow, the conservative mega donor.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: You can get your passport renewed online again. Here's how it works
item.description: The rollout of online passport renewal is restricted to certain windows, beginning midday Eastern time weekly. Officials say the processing times for renewing online are the same as renewing by mail.
item.content:encoded:
The rollout of online passport renewal is restricted to certain windows, beginning midday Eastern time weekly. Officials say the processing times for renewing online are the same as renewing by mail.

(Image credit: Jenny Kane/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Election Tricks in Venezuela; American Students Slowly Return to China
item.description:
Authorities in Venezuela are using all manner of tricks to try to ensure President Nicholas Maduro is reelected next month. However, as we hear, it seems that the stunts and intimidation are not working.

And in China, the number of American's studying abroad is increasing, but is nowhere near pre-COVID levels. We look at why.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities in Venezuela are using all manner of tricks to try to ensure President Nicholas Maduro is reelected next month. However, as we hear, it seems that the stunts and intimidation are not working.

And in China, the number of American's studying abroad is increasing, but is nowhere near pre-COVID levels. We look at why.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Abortion providers back to ‘business as usual’ after high court's mifepristone ruling
item.description: The Supreme Court’s unanimous ruling upholds access to mifepristone, a drug used in more than 60% of abortions. The decision shocked some doctors and abortion rights advocates.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court’s unanimous ruling upholds access to mifepristone, a drug used in more than 60% of abortions. The decision shocked some doctors and abortion rights advocates.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Indigenous Makah tribe in Washington allowed to resume whaling tradition
item.description: The Makah tribe in Washington state will be able to resume their longstanding tradition of whaling, after NOAA Fisheries decided Thursday to give them a waiver for a hunt.
item.content:encoded: The Makah tribe in Washington state will be able to resume their longstanding tradition of whaling, after NOAA Fisheries decided Thursday to give them a waiver for a hunt.
item.dc:creator: Bellamy Pailthorp

item.title: SCOTUS upholds Mifepristone access. What's next for the anti-abortion movement?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Kristen Waggoner, CEO and general counsel of the Alliance Defending Freedom, about Supreme Court preserved access to Mifepristone.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Kristen Waggoner, CEO and general counsel of the Alliance Defending Freedom, about Supreme Court preserved access to Mifepristone.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Heavy rains in South Florida cause major flooding
item.description: South Florida is being pummeled by heavy rain that's caused flooding in communities from Miami and Ft. Lauderdale. The rain, expected to continue through Friday, temporarily forced the closure of Interstate 95.
item.content:encoded: South Florida is being pummeled by heavy rain that's caused flooding in communities from Miami and Ft. Lauderdale. The rain, expected to continue through Friday, temporarily forced the closure of Interstate 95.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: The U.S. is hosting the Cricket World Cup, spurring increased interest in the sport
item.description: For the first time, the United States is hosting the Cricket T20 World Cup. And the U.S. squad is doing well with a critical match set for Friday against Ireland. The success has buoyed interest in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: For the first time, the United States is hosting the Cricket T20 World Cup. And the U.S. squad is doing well with a critical match set for Friday against Ireland. The success has buoyed interest in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: The scientist whose research led to cholesterol-lowering statin drugs, has died.
item.description: Akira Endo, the Japanese scientist whose research led to statin drugs, has died. Tens of millions of people in the U.S. take statins to reduce their cholesterol.
item.content:encoded: Akira Endo, the Japanese scientist whose research led to statin drugs, has died. Tens of millions of people in the U.S. take statins to reduce their cholesterol.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin
